awd_titl_txt: Technician Training in Advanced Building Performance Analysis and Verification
awd_abstract_narration:
In order to meet the demand for highly educated technicians in the modern construction industry, Central Carolina Community College (CCCC) will expand the curricula of their Sustainability Technologies and Building Construction Technologies programs. Today's construction industry is a high tech landscape that plays a significant role in human health, resource management, and energy consumption. Modern buildings contain complex systems that require skilled technicians to properly design, install, and verify using technical skills along with scientific and mathematical theory and knowledge. This trend in the construction industry has led to industry demand for individuals with enhanced education and credentials to ensure buildings meet performance criteria. Informed by their industrial partners, CCCC will provide internships and field experiences that prepare students to earn relevant third party credentials that prepare them for the workforce. 

This project will directly benefit three groups; students, CCCC, and local industry.  For student technicians, they will receive (1) a value added educational experience with both institutional and third party credentialing, (2) multiple avenues for success through educational pathways and stackable credentialing, and (3) increased field experience.  CCCC will (1) update curricula to better educate students interested in energy analysis and performance verification, (2) strengthen connections between the college and local industry, and (3) address technical education needs of underrepresented populations in the college's service area. The benefit of this approach to industry will be (1) the increased pool of well-trained new employees, and (2) the increased ease of hiring new employees with college credit training and industry specific, nationally recognized credentials.

por.por_cntn:
Central Carolina Community College (CCCC) recently reached the conclusion of The Technician Training in Advanced Building Performance project. This noteworthy undertaking, funded by the Advanced Technological Education (ATE) program of the National Science Foundation (NSF), has facilitated significant advancements for the college and its students.

The goal of the Technician Training in Advanced Building Performance project was to provide educational opportunities for developing technician skills, competencies, and hands-on experiences needed for employment in the fields of energy efficiency verification and building performance analysis. The primary objective of the project was to strategically revise the pre-existing Green Building Certificate at CCCC. This revision was critical for the program to address the evolving demands of the high-performance building sector. A standout feature of the updated curriculum was the integration of an industry-recognized third-party credential. With this addition, students now not only acquire technical skills and knowledge, but also posess a certification that holds weight in the nationwide job market.

The updated curriculum also facilitated a partnership between CCCC and Chatham Habitat for Humanity (CHFH), a local leader in creating energy-efficient and affordable housing in the area.  The partnership, now several years old, has given students enrolled in the Green Building Certificate program the opportunity to implement the skills they learn in the classroom by constructing an energy efficient home from start to finish.  Once completed, the student-built home provides an affordable residence for a deserving individual or family in the local area.  Direct engagement with these “real-life” projects helps students translate their academic learnings into tangible skills, and emphasizes the power of collaborations as they begin their professional pursuits.  The partnership between CCCC and CHFH has proven to be a practical, engaging, and equitable endeavor that is changing the lives of both students and the local community.  

Certificate enrollment and completion increased for the certificate program over the course of the project, in spite of the challenges posed by the COVID-19 pandemic. Graduates of the program have leveraged the knowledge and skills they gained in their coursework, and have begun careers in fields related to energy-efficient construction and building performance analysis.  The success of these students is further testament to the project's wide-reaching influence and its role in reinforcing ties between CCCC and the local industry.

The momentum gained from the project’s success hasn’t waned since its completion. CCCC, recognizing the significant demand in the high-performance construction sector, decided to adopt the Green Building Certificate as a stackable credential to the existing Building Construction Technology Associate Degree program. CCCC’s continued support only furthers access and interest in programs like the Green Building Certificate that lead to life changing educational experiences for students.  This move also underscores the college's unwavering dedication to leading-edge, industry-relevant education.

The Technician Training in Advanced Building Performance award has been nothing short of transformative for Central Carolina Community College. From curriculum overhauls, to increasing enrollment, to fostering community relations; its positive impact resonates deeply, promising a future filled with opportunity, growth, and sustainable innovation for the college and its students.

 


Last Modified: 10/04/2023
Modified by: Andrew Mcmahan
